title: Trump Signs Epstein Files Transparency Act; DOJ to Release Documents
snippets: Donald Trump has signed a law requiring the US Justice Department to release the remaining Epstein files within 30 days.
US President Donald Trump has said he signed a bill requiring the Justice Department to release files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
The bill gives the US Justice Department 30 days to release all the files in a searchable format.

President Trump has signed a bill to compel the Justice Department to make public its files on the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Now, there's a 30-day countdown for the DOJ to produce those records.
Trump signs bill ordering DOJ to release Epstein files Axios
President Donald Trump said in a social media post on Wednesday night that he signed the Jeffrey Epstein files bill.
Trump signs bill approving Epstein files release Reuters
Trump signs bill to release Epstein files Reuters
The Jeffrey Epstein files bill was overwhelmingly passed by the House and Senate. Only Republican Rep. Clay Higgins of Louisiana voting against it.

The legislation compels Atty. Gen. Pam Bondi to make available "all unclassified records, documents, communications and investigative materials" in the Epstein files within 30 days.

President attacks Democrats in post on Truth Social after US lawmakers swiftly move bill through Congress Donald Trump signed a bill on Wednesday directing the justice department to release files from the investigation into the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein , surrendering in the face of joint pr
The bill requires the DOJ to release all files and communications related to Epstein within 30 days. Redactions for "embarrassment" are not allowed.
Trump signs bill to release Jeffrey Epstein case files after fighting it for months AP News

When it comes to the Epstein files, there are solid reasons to withold certain information from the public, experts say. However, there are also grey areas that could cause disputes between lawmakers and the U.S. Department of Justice, and which could frustrate those seeking as much information as p
Trump Signs Epstein Files Bill After Fight That Split GOP Bloomberg.com

Trump signs bill ordering US justice department to release Epstein files

Trump caves to democracy, signs bill to release Epstein files

Why the U.S. Justice Department and Congress may battle over redaction of Epstein files

summary: President Donald Trump signed the Epstein Files Transparency Act, mandating the U.S. Department of Justice to release all unclassified materials related to Jeffrey Epstein within 30 days in a searchable format. The bill, which saw overwhelming support in Congress, was passed with only Rep. Clay Higgins opposing it. This move comes after significant pressure and a swift legislative process, with Attorney General Pam Bondi confirming the DOJ's commitment to comply with the new law.
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive as it reports on a significant development (the signing of the Epstein Files Transparency Act) and the subsequent action to be taken by the DOJ. summary: In August 2025, 47 undergraduates from NASA's Student Airborne Research Program (SARP) presented their summer research projects. These projects, guided by faculty advisors and graduate mentors from various universities, covered topics from methane emissions in swamps to aerosol pollution in coastal regions, and the impact of dairies on ozone production. The presentations were made to an audience that included mentors, professors, family, friends, and NASA personnel, marking the culmination of the program's summer internship.

title: U.S. Risks Measles Endemic Amid 45 Outbreaks, Anti-Vax Movement Influence
snippets: With 45 outbreaks of measles over the past year, the United States is at risk of endemic spread within months, experts told Live Science.

Canada has lost its measles elimination status and the U.S. is likely to be next. These failures are the result of the anti-vaccination movement, bolstered by the appointment of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. — and it's a bellwether of the erosion of public health.
titles: US could lose its measles elimination status within months, experts say
The US is on track to lose its measles elimination status in months. RFK needs to go.
summary: The U.S. faces the risk of measles becoming endemic due to 45 outbreaks in the last year, partly attributed to the anti-vaccination movement and figures like Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Canada has already lost its measles elimination status, and the U.S. may follow if the virus spreads continuously for 12 months.
